A wireless router is an electronic device supplied by an internet service provider that lets you connect to the internet. It sends data from the internet cable converts it into radio signals, which are then picked up by devices like mobile phones, desktops, laptops, and gaming consoles. You can also connect the router to your smart TV and stream 4K videos, movies, You Tube and other apps. Your router will have an IP address. The DHCP or Device Host Configuration Protocol is a feature that enables the private IP address to each device in the network. You will have to manually configure the IP address of every device that wants to join the network, in absence of the DHCP feature. There are two types of routers- wired and wireless. A wired router is directly connected to desktops through wires. They usually have a port that connects to the modem to access the internet. A wireless router connects directly to a modem by a cable which allows it to receive and transmit information. The router has built-in antennas to improve the signal coverage, through which it is connected to your home or office Wi-Fi network. This enables all of your connected devices to have internet access. There are many types of ports present in your Wi-Fi router. The most common are USB port and the SIM card slot. You can plug in the USB or Data cards from your ISPs can be used. You can insert the SIM card from your service provider to access internet.
